analysisEngineMetaData.name: LanguageWare Lexical Annotator
analysisEngineMetaData.description: This annotator provides access to LanguageWare Lexical Analysis.

configurationParameter.name: SofaNames
configurationParameter.description: The Sofa names the annotator should work on. If no names are specified, the annotator works on the default sofa.

configurationParameter.name: LWDataSubdir
configurationParameter.description: The name of the directory under the UIMA data directory in which the LanguageWare resources are located

configurationParameter.name: UseExplicitDicts
configurationParameter.description: Dictionaries to be used are specified explicitly in this config file.

configurationParameter.name: PreloadLanguages
configurationParameter.description: A list of all languages which should be pre-loaded at init-time in the form xx-YY (xx=lang, YY=sublang/country)

configurationParameter.name: DefaultLanguage
configurationParameter.description: The language to use in processing when the document language is not set before the annotator processing.

configurationParameter.name: DictionaryCacheSize
configurationParameter.description: !Deprecated! Maximum number of dictionaries held in cache

configurationParameter.name: ProcessLanguagesWithNoDictionaries
configurationParameter.description: Control the annotator behaviour if no dictionaries are configured for the processed document language. If "tokenize", only basic tokenization will be possible. If "skip", processing will be terminated with no errors. If "error", an exception will be thrown. The default value is "skip".

configurationParameter.name: UseFirstMatchPolicy
configurationParameter.description: If true lookup stops after the first match in any dictionary (DLTCM_POLICY_FIRST) otherwise all matches from all dictionaries are found (DLTCM_POLICY_ALL)

configurationParameter.name: UseStrictCaseMode
configurationParameter.description: If true, the strict-case mode is turned 'ON'. That means Case information will be respected when doing lookup in lowercase dictionaries. otherwise, it will set strict-case mode to 'OFF' and a match will be returned even if the case doesn't match.

configurationParameter.name: UseRelativeTokenAndSentenceNumbers
configurationParameter.description: If true token and sentence numbers are reset to 1 for each new sentence/paragraph

configurationParameter.name: AnnotateMWConstituentTokens
configurationParameter.description: If true, MWU annotations will be created for Multi-Word entries and Token Annotations will be created for their constituent words; otherwise, Only MWU annotations will be created.

configurationParameter.name: MWBoundary
configurationParameter.description: This defines MWUs lookup boundaries. possible values for this parameter are: "Sentence", "Paragraph", or "Document".

configurationParameter.name: IgnorePunctuationTokens
configurationParameter.description: If true, punctuation tokens are ignored

configurationParameter.name: AggressiveSentenceBreaks
configurationParameter.description: !Deprecated! If true, an end-of-line will be considered end-of-sentence

configurationParameter.name: CrossDictionaryDecomposition
configurationParameter.description: If true a decomposition is performed across dictionaries i.e. words from several dictionaries may be combined into one compound

configurationParameter.name: BOFAOnlyDecomposition
configurationParameter.description: If true a decomposition is performed basing on BOFA values only.

configurationParameter.name: FilterDecomposedGlosses
configurationParameter.description: If true, the paradigms reported by decomposition for each component are filtered according to the decomposition rules, removing paradigms that are not valid in combination. Setting this to false may lead to better performance and recall at the expense of precision.

configurationParameter.name: StandaloneDecomposition
configurationParameter.description: If true, the lexical analyzer tries to decompose dictionary-matched entries which have a compound flag.

configurationParameter.name: JapaneseDecomposition
configurationParameter.description: If true decomposition is done for Japanese documents without regard to the result specification

configurationParameter.name: JapaneseDeepWordBreak
configurationParameter.description: If true returns Japanese word suffixes separated from their stems

configurationParameter.name: CreateCompoundPartsInsteadOfToken
configurationParameter.description: If true then compound parts are created not as type uima.tt.CompPartAnnotation but as uima.tt.TokenAnnotation. The annotations for a compound parts of a complex word are created instead of (not in addition to) the token for the whole complex word.

configurationParameter.name: ReturnOnlyFirstLevelOfCompoundBreakdown
configurationParameter.description: If true then for compounds which have several decompositions are only the first (longest match) decomposition is returned. E.g. for the German "Segelschullehrer" only "Segelschul"+"lehrer" is returned and not also "Segel" + "schul"+ "lehrer"

configurationParameter.name: CreateDecompStructure
configurationParameter.description: If true, then full decomp analysis structure is created. This option is intended to be used mutually exclusively with the previous two.

configurationParameter.name: BreakOnHyphens
configurationParameter.description: !Deprecated! If true then we will try to break unknown words if it contains a hyphen

configurationParameter.name: DoLookupVariant
configurationParameter.description: If true lookup unknown word in variant dictionary.

configurationParameter.name: DoRuleBasedNormalization4All
configurationParameter.description: If true lookup a variant with rulebased normalization for all unknown word.

configurationParameter.name: DoRuleBasedNormalization4Katakana
configurationParameter.description: If true lookup a variant with rulebased normalization only for katakana word.

configurationParameter.name: CreateGenericAnnotations
configurationParameter.description: Create Generic annotations if annotate glosses availables.

configurationParameter.name: CheckGenericTypes
configurationParameter.description: Check the types when writing the feature values for generic annotations.

configurationParameter.name: GlossComparatorClassname
configurationParameter.description: The full name of the class implementation for the Comparator interface to be used for sorting gloss collections.

configurationParameter.name: LemmaPoolingThreshold
configurationParameter.description: A threshold that is used to control lemma Pooling. Pooling enhance memory usage of the annotator. It is good when processing large documents. Setting the value to 0 means always enabled; while setting its value to -1 disables pooling.

configurationParameter.name: LexicalDicts
configurationParameter.description: File name of dictionaries for the lexical analysis

configurationParameter.name: MultiWordDicts
configurationParameter.description: File name of dictionaries for the specific multi-word unit

configurationParameter.name: OOVDicts
configurationParameter.description: File name of dictionaries for the morphological guesser (out-of-vocabulary)

configurationParameter.name: SynonymDicts
configurationParameter.description: File name of dictionaries for synonyms

configurationParameter.name: VariantDicts
configurationParameter.description: File name of dictionaries for word variants

configurationParameter.name: SpellCorrectionDicts
configurationParameter.description: File name of dictionaries for the spelling correction

configurationParameter.name: PartOfSpeechDict
configurationParameter.description: File name of dictionary for the Part-of-Speech Tagging

configurationParameter.name: PostTagHandling
configurationParameter.description: Post tag handling policy

configurationParameter.name: PostLemmaEntryHandling
configurationParameter.description: Post LemmaEntries handling policy

configurationParameter.name: MaxCharNumPerSentence
configurationParameter.description: The maximum number of characters in a sentence.

configurationParameter.name: BreakRulesSpec
configurationParameter.description: Break rules to be used.

configurationParameter.name: DecompositionRulesSpec
configurationParameter.description: Decomposition rules to be used.

configurationGroup.names: default af ar ca cs da de el en es fr he it ja nb nl nn pl pt ru sv zh

typeDescription.name: uima.tcas.DocumentAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Annotation covering the entire document, containing document meta information, for example the document language

featureDescription.name: languageCandidates
featureDescription.description: A list of language candidates for the document produced during language identification. These are sorted by confidence value

typeDescription.name: uima.tt.TTAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Base type for lexical and document structure annotation types

typeDescription.name: uima.tt.DocStructureAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Base type for document structure annotation types

featureDescription.name: paragraphNumber
featureDescription.description: The sequence number of the paragraph in the document

featureDescription.name: sentenceNumber
featureDescription.description: The sequence number of the sentence in the paragraph (or the document)

typeDescription.name: uima.tt.LexicalAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Base type for lexical annotation types

typeDescription.name: uima.tt.DictionaryEntryAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Base type for dictionary-based user-defined annotation types

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: Morphological information for the dictionary entry

typeDescription.name: uima.tt.TokenLikeAnnotation
typeDescription.description: Base type for token annotation types

featureDescription.name: lemma
featureDescription.description: The best probable entry containing all morphological information for the token

featureDescription.name: lemmaEntries
featureDescription.description: List of lemma entries containing all morphological information for the token

featureDescription.name: dictionaryMatch
featureDescription.description: A flag indicating whether or not the token matches a dictionary entry

typeDescription.name: uima.tt.TokenAnnotation
typeDescription.description: General token annotation type. It is also the base type for the special token types

typeDescription.name: uima.tt.CompPartAnnotation
typeDescription.description: A part of a compound word

typeDescription.name: uima.tt.KeyStringEntry
typeDescription.description: Base type for types defining key/value feature (e.g. uima.tt.Lemma type)

featureDescription.name: key
featureDescription.description: A key/value feature (e.g. lemma string in uima.tt.Lemma type)

typeDescription.name: uima.tt.Lemma
typeDescription.description: Morphological information retrieved from a lexical dictionary entry

featureDescription.name: partOfSpeech
featureDescription.description: An integral encoding representing the part-of-speech for the lemma

featureDescription.name: frost_ExtendedPOS
featureDescription.description: An integer representing additional information related to the part-of-speech

typeDescription.name: uima.tt.LanguageConfidencePair
typeDescription.description: Language-Confidence pair of a language candidate for the document text

featureDescription.name: languageConfidence
featureDescription.description: An indication (a float value between 0 and 1) of how well the candidate language actually fits the language of the document

typeDescription.name: com.ibm.langware.uimatypes.WordLikeToken
typeDescription.description: Base type for possible words (not punctuations nor symbols). Also represents alphanumeric tokens
